comment: This was an online summer class. We had a discussion and two replies every week as well as a quiz. The discussions weren't too boring and there were two prompts each week so they weren't horrible to make responses. Because it was a summer class there was A LOT of reading and unless you love government its a drag of a class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: PROFESSOR PURCELL IS VERY SWEET AND EASY GOING. AMERICAN GOV IS ALREADY A SIMPLE STRAIGHTFOWARD CLASS SO HER D2L BEING ORGANIZED HELPED. THE CLASS CONSSITED OF 8 DICUSSION PSOTS AND 8 QUIZZES. NO LOCKDOWN BROWSER.

Extremely tough grader and pretty specific about how discussion posts look. The assignment openings run Wednesday-Thursday instead of the normal Monday through Sunsay. No lockdown. She is very nice though I just didn't love the class set up. Textbook required.
I enjoyed this class and professor.

Overall a very good professor. She responds to emails very quickly and will give extended time on assignments if you need it. I was sick and asked for an extension from her. She emailed back within 10 minutes and said to take as much time as I needed, no questions asked. She is slow to grade, so I didn't get my essays back for over a month for each

I LOVE THIS PROFESSOR! she gave the best feedback and she was so caring. I had no problem emailing her about grades, questions, etc. I would love to take her again if I could! I was fully online with her, and I passed her class with an A. I would have loved to meet her in person! BEST BEST BEST !!!! 10/10!!! If you can take her DO IT!!

Very easy class! Discussion posts and quiz every week. You get two attempts on this quiz and its untimed. There are 2 essays, if you follow the instructions you will make an A. She gives feedback on assignments, answers emails in a timely manner, and does a weekly check-in. I highly recommend!

Her class is so easy to make an A in if you simply turn in your work. If you understand anything about basic government, you will have no problem answering what she asks. Each week there is a short essay, discussion, and quiz that are all very accomplishable. I loved her and she was more lenient than she seems.

LOVE LOVE LOVE her!!! literally, a super easy A. She is sweet and understanding. If you don't get an A you literally just didn't even try. No homework just a website you make and update every week about your internship. Really simple class.

I LOVED Professor Purcell! She was amazing! It was a summer course so there was a lot of material to learn in a few weeks but she made it very easy to do so. She was very clear on grading, and what was expected of each assignment. Take her class if you can!
She is the nicest professor I have ever taken at KSU. I had her for the internship course. She is super laid back and understanding with everything. I would defintely take her again.

Professor Purcell has been a fantastic embodiment of how a professor should carry themselves! The entire semester she made herself available and made our content interactive. Kudos! Definitely take her, I promise you wont regret it.

Dr. P is probably one of the best professors I have ever taken at KSU! She truly cares about you and your success and during this COVID-19 situation, she has been so open to extra assignments to help fulfill hours that I couldn't during my internship. No hesitation, would take her again!

Dr. Purcell is not the best teacher; her assignments have bad instructions, the powerpoint presentations look like a grade schooler did them, the class is only geared towards part of the INTS majors, the syllabus is inaccurate, and she uses Sam Allman's materials rather than creating her own assignments and presentations. Very easy class, though.
I loved having Dr. Purcell as a professor. She is really caring and wants to see her students grow as leaders, which is awesome! Would take again.
Online course was straight forward - if you can manage your time, you'll be fine staying on top of the coursework. Interesting class and great professor.

Went out of my way to make sure I could get in her class. She uses the text quite a bit and wants you to cite what you read as much as possible. A few quizzes, discussions and a final. Do the work, get the A. Very responsive to any kind of grading issue or question on assignments.
She's great! I've had her for other classes. Very responsive and fair grading. If you have any kind of issue be sure to ask. She is very supportive of your future and wants you to succeed.
Awsome professor! Foundations was one of the best online courses I've taken at KSU
Great Professor!
Awesome teacher. Do your work, you'll pass. Couple tests, weekly discussions, group project, etc. Take her!
Very easy - just a group project, two tests, and weekly discussion posts.

I love Dr. Purcell. This is my second time taking her for an online class. She is clear with what she wants you to do and will respond quick and efficiently when you need help. This class is basically just discussion posts, 2 tests, and a group project (which isn't bad if you have a good group). I would take her again in a heartbeat.

I did a seven week leadership course. It was good! She was well organized, she gave clear instructions, and good feedback. I thought the course was going to be overwhelming being a 7 week course, but she made it a easy breeze. If you do your work, and follow guidelines you're in good shape. I would take her again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I had her for 2 leadership courses over the summer (Foundations and Service) and she was great in both. The assignments were doable but you did have to make yourself aware of the material. I got A's in both classes, but you will have to do some work. If you do that, you'll be totally fine. There is NO late work or extra credit but you won't need it

I enjoyed Dr. Purcell's class & would gladly take her again.  This was an online summer course but I was able to handle the workload with no problem.  If you follow her instructions and put forth the effort, it can be an easy & enjoyable course.

LDRS 3000. Professor Purcell was great. It was an online class. Has a twitter feed and uses it to interact with students. Clear instructions. Loved how she broke down online discussions. 4 Tests. 1 final (wished it was 2 hours for 80 questions instead of 1 hr 30 minutes). Loved her. Would take her in a heart beat. Learned a lot about leadership.

Great professor. Class was a breeze. Follow the instructions, read and you'll do just fine. Quizzes and final exam are open book/notes. Three short quizzes and one test.  80 multiple choice/true & false
I took LDRS3000 online with Dr. Purcell. Great professor! Do your work correctly and your grade will reflect! I made an A, and would take her again in a heart beat.

This was my 1st time taking online classes and it was June  condensed(4 weeks) session. Loved this class and professor. Thank you for your clear instructions which is very important for online classes. I got an 'A.  :) She is amazing!
LOVED HER. I wish all my professors taught with her style. She's a must take!
By taking her I got to the hall of fame! I would take her class again!
I have taken her for two classes and I received a A. You must turn in your work on time. Great Professor.
Class was okay. Feedback was sometimes delayed. Was not my best educator at KSU.

This is not an easy A, but you will learn a lot of useful info that can actually help you navigate your academic and professional career. Start the paper early and do not leave it to last minute! Dr. Purcell is an accessible, kind and responsive teacher. She wants to see her students succeed! Textbook is a tad dry and you must READ it!

I only take online classes and can say that many KSU professors should not instruct online. This is not one of those professors! She is so organized and starts each week with a video. She responds to emails quickly. Assignments are challenging yet rewarding. Participation and dedication are key because there are weekly assignments and DB posts.

Dr Purcell was an excellent professor. Responds to emails quickly and gives good feedback. Weekly discussion post, two peer responses, & short 5 Q quiz. Two tests: midterm and final. Both were rather easy. Reading material is important but simple if you take your time. BEST CLASS. EASY A. GREAT PROF.
Gives videos for each week to give all the students a review of what's due that week. As long as you read the material, you shouldn't have any issues

I took this class online as a 7 week session. Keep up with your work and do the discussion posts and quizzes, since it was shorter you always had something due. She did not give any tests other than a midterm and final. She also had us do an 8-10 paper leadership paper, other than the length it was not hard at all.

The class is time consuming. She is very organized so it is easy to keep up with. Lots of discussion board activity. Midterm and Final only. One large paper based on an interview - this was a little overwhelming. She did not provide questions to ask the leader; that aspect was challenging. Everything is doable.

She is an amazing professor. Clear grading rubrics & great feedback. She answers emails promptly & responds to any questions. Reading is necessary in order to pass, but is interesting. The discussion posts are an easy grade (participation matters). One long essay. Put your heart into your work & it'll be an easy A.   10/10 would recommend.
She was a great professor!

I loved Dr. Purcell! This was my first leadership class and I was a little nervous about it! For a 7 week class, this was awesome! Study the powerpoints and log into D2L frequently. Clear on what is to be done every week. Definitely taking again!

I took her online. She gave weekly video updates. The class was set up neatly and it was very straight forward. It was also a 7 week term so It went by fast. Discussion boards every week and a easy quick quiz. We had one easy paper that she graded fairly. Just follow the syllabus and her requirements and you will get an A no doubt!!

Dr. Purcell was  a great professor and was clear in her expectations.  The group project was a bit frustrating to coordinate, but she was very fair in grading.  There is no final exam and as long as you keep up with weekly blogs you will do great.  She is very easy to communicate with and offers extra credit.
Great professor. Always willing to help if needed. I would take her again.
Great Professor. Very professional and reliable.  Expectations are clearly outlined at the beginning of semester.
Great Professor I enjoyed the course
The class was fun. Just make sure to stay on top of discussion post and check d2l regularly. Great teacher who gives good feedback
Great Class!

Great professor. I took her initially for my LDRS 3000 class and enjoyed it so much I took two more of her classes. You need to read, and participate in class. She assigns a few papers every semester, usually ranging from 3-5 pages in length. Usually assigns a group project or two. Great professor who really cares about you as a student and person!
quizes and discussion every week!

Dr. Purcell was amazing. As my first Leadership class at KSU, as well as my first time with her, I was thoroughly impressed. Her class is very easy, but you will learn a lot through "hands-on" experiences. If your are a leadership major, or just like me strollin through a leadership course, I would say she is a must take, no doubt.

Dr. Purcell is quick to respond to e-mails and giving feedback on assignments. She is also clear on her instructions for assignments by uploading a helpful video that you can watch throughout the week.
Dr. Purcell is on top of grading assignments and answering questions  a great online class.
Dr. Purcell is very nice, but her class wasn't very structured. It is an easy A. The class was a "play in the sand box and see what we come up with" class.

Confusing at first. Unsure of how her syllabus should be planned out but works with you, the students, to clear it up and choose how you want it to be structured. Lots of freedom, may freak you out at first.   Not hard to get an A in the class. Group Projects are left and right, be ready.

It was an absolute pleasure having Dr. Purcell for service as leadership.  She created a classroom where we learned how to think for ourselves and experience learning rather than just absorb. TAKE HER.  DR. P you da bomb.  Thanks for getting me along with Maurice to the Hall of Fame.  Cheers
Dr. Purcell takes the time to make you understand the content. No written exams at all!
She was very good abut answering emails and questions in a timely manor. I would recommend her!! She is very sweet and also a great class.
She is such a great teacher! Works with you and also responds to e-mail quickly. Weekly discussions that are actually relevant but still interesting and fun.  I would take her again without a doubt.

Dr. Purcell is a great professor!  I am currently taking her 3000/Leadership  class.  Dr. Purcell is very clear cut.  Her syllabus was very clear and detailed as to what would be expected throughout the course.  Even though it was an online class, Dr. Purcell checked in via video on several occasions to make sure the class was on course thus far.

Super nice lady who posts videos every now and then to remind you what needs to be done. All you have to do is one easy discussion post a week and comment on two others, one midterm, a group project and final paper. Pretty much a guaranteed A and I only opened the textbook once.

Dr. Purcell is AMAZING! Had her for my 1st Maymester-- and let's just say she exceeded my expectations! Quirky, great lecturer, well educated, personable & understanding that college students have lives and incredibly flexible with her grading criteria and assignments. I AM taking her again!

Dr. Purcell is very helpful, welcomes discussion, fosters a dynamic learning environment, and provides many resources to equip you in your future ventures and practice of leadership and following leaders!  She displays great leadership as evident by the various leadership theories studied in the course. Great leadergreat coursegreat learning!
Always willing to help.
For a Maymester OUTSTANDING!!!!!!!!  Worked with the students to create the best working envoiroment for all to suceed.  Would recommend to anyone!!!!!!

She made the class interesting. She made adjustments to assignments and the class schedule pending on what the needs were that we had as students. She is pretty funny and very knowledgeable about the course subject.

Do what you are asked and the rest comes natural. She lines up everything perfectly as long as you do what your told. Stay on top of things and you will succeed. She keeps the class entertained with awesome leadership tests that you learn about yourself and others. I took this as a may mester course and LOVE IT! Awesome Professor!

She is a wonderful professor, and really just wants her students to do well. Expect work, but interesting work. I had her for a maymester and loved the class. I would take her for a leadership class 4 more times if I could!
Dr. Purcell is a wonderful professor with great insight into leadership. The content of her classes is relevant to modern day organizations and I got a lot out of her class. Highly recommend!

Professor Purcell's class is a real character builder. I would keep taking them if I could but have to move on to other things. She is understanding and willing to work with you, if you missed an assignment.

She is extremely passionate about what she teaches. Also very inspirational and encouraging. I would definitely take her again. She truly cares about you as a student and wants you to succeed in her class as well as outside the classroom. I plan to take her again for another course in the near future.
Dr. Purcell is a great professor. She is flexible and allows students to participate in their own way.  She is so interesting so do not forget to ask her about her travels!
